alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 2:51AM MST until December 26 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches across the Wasatch back and Uinta County, with 1 to 3 inches across eastern Box Elder County and the Cache Valley. Winds gusting in excess of 45 mph this morning. * WHERE...In Wyoming, Southwest Wyoming. In Utah, Cache Valley/Utah Portion, Wasatch Back, Bear Lake and Bear River Valley and Eastern Box Elder County. * WHEN...Until noon MST today. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions can be expected across the area late tonight through Sunday morning. Gusty winds may also result in considerable blowing and drifting of new snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall can be expected this morning with the passage of a cold front.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511. For winter road conditions from the Wyoming Department of Transportation, visit http://www.wyoroad.info or dial 511.
